cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 90 (Thursday, May 23, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. LUNA:H.R. 8541.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, clause 18The single subject of this legislation is:This bill would shorten the adoption wait period from oneyear to six months and makes it a felony to knowinglytransfer a wild horse or burro for slaughter.[Page H3524]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

bill.title: Wild Horse Integrity and Slaughter Prevention Act

item.title: Wild Horse Integrity and Slaughter Prevention Act
Wild Horse Integrity and Slaughter Prevention Act

To amend the Wild Free-Roaming Horses and Burros Act to provide for criminal penalties for acquiring a wild free-roaming horse or burro with the intention of transferring such animal for processing into commercial products, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
